vrt::BasicCommandPacket::BasicCommandPacket ( const void *  buf,

Creates a new instance accessing the given data buffer.

Parameters:
buf The pointer to the packet buffer.
len The length of the packet buffer.
readOnly Should users of this instance be able to modify the underlying data buffer?
vrt::BasicCommandPacket::BasicCommandPacket (  ) 

Creates a new instance that can be written to.

Initially this will just be a simple context packet with no fields set (other than the required packet length of 8 and a default stream ID of 0).

vrt::BasicCommandPacket::BasicCommandPacket ( int32_t  bufsize  ) 

Creates a new instance with a default anticipated length that can be written to.

Initially this will just be a simple context packet with no fields set (other than the required packet length of 8 and a default stream ID of 0), but will have the underlying buffers pre-allocated as required.

Parameters:
bufsize The anticipated buffer size.
vrt::BasicCommandPacket::BasicCommandPacket ( const vector< char > &  buf,
bool  readOnly = false 
)

Creates a new instance accessing the given data buffer.

Note that when the buffer lengths are given, only the most minimal of error checking is done. Users should call isPacketValid() to verify that the packet is valid. Invalid packets can result unpredictable behavior, but this is explicitly allowed (to the extent possible) so that applications creating packets can use this class even if the packet isn't yet "valid".

Parameters:
buf The data buffer to use.
readOnly Should users of this instance be able to modify the underlying data buffer?
Exceptions:
VRTException If the offset is negative or greater than the length of the buffer given. Also thrown if the buffer length is -1 and a copy can not be made because the sizes in the header of the packet are invalid.
vrt::BasicCommandPacket::BasicCommandPacket ( const BasicVRTPacket &  p,
PacketType  type,
int64_t  classID,
int32_t  minPayloadLength,
int32_t  maxPayloadLength 
) [protected]

Internal constructor, for use by subclasses.

p The packet (already initialized).
type The expected packet type.
classID The expected classID.
minPayloadLength The minimum payload length.
maxPayloadLength The maximum payload length (<0 if not pre-defined).
Exceptions:
VRTException If packet type or classID of the packet are invalid, or if the payload length is invalid.

Member Function Documentation

virtual string vrt::BasicCommandPacket::getPacketValid ( bool  strict,
int32_t  length 
) const [virtual]

Checks to see if the packet is valid.

This is identical to isPacketValid(int32_t) except that a description of the error is returned.

Parameters:
strict Should strict checking be done, or just enough to verify that things are OK for reading. No packet failing strict checking should ever be sent out, but it may be useful to disable strict checking when reading in a packet.
length Verifies that the length of the packet matches this value.
Returns:
Empty string ("") if it is valid, a description of the error otherwise.

Reimplemented from vrt::BasicVRTPacket.

Reimplemented in vrt::BasicControlPacket.

virtual int32_t vrt::BasicCommandPacket::getPktSpecificPrologueLength (  )  const [virtual]

Prepares a packet for resend resetting any non-persistent values.

This is implemented as follows: Gets the packet specific prologue (PSP) length in bytes. The length of the PSP will be a value up to MAX_PKT_SPECIFIC_PROLOGUE_LENGTH. The PSP length will always be a multiple of 4-bytes.

Returns:
The length of the packet specific prologue in bytes.

Reimplemented from vrt::BasicVRTPacket.

Reimplemented in vrt::BasicControlPacket.

virtual int32_t vrt::BasicCommandPacket::getPrologueLength (  )  const [virtual]

Gets the prologue length in bytes (includes header and packet specific prologue, but does not include trailer).

The length of the prologue will be a value up to MAX_PROLOGUE_LENGTH. The prologue length will always be a multiple of 4-bytes.

Returns:
The length of the prologue in bytes.

Reimplemented from vrt::BasicVRTPacket.

Reimplemented in vrt::BasicControlPacket.
